name: Austin, William
bio: Unionist, refugee in North during war

bio: Whig, Douglas supporter in 1860, opposed secession, refugee

name: Collins, Alfred
bio: Whig, Unionist, accused of murdering Congressman Haughey

name: Dykes, George
bio: Voted for Douglas in 1860, anti-secessionist, Unionist

name: Ewing, William*
bio: Voted for Douglas in 1860, anti-secessionist, left GA for northern AL in 1862

name: Garrison, William
bio: Unionist, refugee in North, Freedmen's Bureau agent, Unionist, Confederate officer

name: Hayes, Charles
bio: Douglas Democrat, Confederate officer, threatened by KKK

name: Moore, Stephen
future.office: Registrar in 1867,candidate for state senator in 1868

name: Peters, Thomas
bio: Unionist, pro-Douglas in 1860, former Whig, fled to North, read French and Latin

name: Russell, Timothy*
former.office: (Delegate to 1861 secession conv. and 1865 const. convention)

name: Saffold, Benjamin
bio: Douglas Democrat, fled to North, father justice on state supreme court

name: Semple, Henry*
bio: Unionist, Confederate major, nephew of President John Tyler Unionist

name: Walker, James
bio: Union captain, organized a peace movement in 1862

name: Whelan, Benjamin
bio: Unionist, former Whig, Confederate veteran, Douglas supporter in 1860

name: Wilhite, J. W. *
bio: Charged with treason, joined Union army, former Whig, voted for Douglas in 1860

bio: Union sergeant, captured during war and imprisoned in very room in which const. convention assembled

name: Cypert, J. N. *
bio: Confederate major, prisoner of war, voted against secession

name: Exon, Solomon
bio: Was "always loyal" and had difficulties with Confederate authorities

bio: Former Whig, married to cousin of Mrs. "Stonewall" Jackson

name: Hodges,Asa
future.office: State senator, state representative, U.S. Congress
bio: Arrested by Confederates as a spy

name: Kyle, Gayle
bio: Unionist, elected to Congress in 1865 (not seated)

name: McCown, George
bio: Confederate captain, stressed east TN birth to census

name: Misner, Peter
bio: Rebels drove him from his home and his wife

name: Ratcliffe, H. W.
bio: Late to convention due to illness

name: VanHook, R. C.
bio: Former overseer, served in Confederate home guard, opposed slavery

name: Walker, Charles*
bio: His father, David Walker, was president of secession convention, Confederate veteran

name: Krimminger, John*t
bio: Confederate deserter, joined Union army, assassinated in 1871

name: Akerman, Amos
bio: Confederate colonel in home guard, Whig, opposed secession, Dartmouth graduate, tutored children of John Berrien, who was Andtew Jackson's first attorney general

name: Caldwell, John
bio: Wrote account of Ashburn's death for New York Tribune

name: Cole, Henry
bio: Imprisoned as spy by Confederates, Unionist

name: Dunning, James
future.office: State senator, U.S. marshal, postmaster of Atlanta
bio: Unionist, arrested during war, later labored unsuccessfully to place statue of Pres. Lincoln in downtown Atlanta

name: cCay, Henry
bio: Opposed secession, supported Stephen Douglas in 1860, Princeton graduate

name: Saffold, Thomas
bio: Voted initially to delay secession, then supported it

name: Waddell, James
future.office: Clerk of state house of representatives

name: Beldon, Simeon
bio: Wartime Unionist, presided over lower house of Unionist wartime legislature

name: Blackburn, W. Jasper

name: Crawford, Thomas
bio: Former Whig, Unionist, fled to NY during war, assassinated in 1873

name: Dearing, George
bio: Had son who was 16 in 1860 who could possibly have been this delegate

name: Demarest, Andrew
bio: Unionist, living in New Orleans in 1870

name: Duplessis, Charles
bio: Unionist, wounded in New Orleans riot of July 1866

name: Jones, Simeon

name: Lewis, James B.
bio: Unionist, sometimes classified as black, colonel in state militia

future.office: Chief justice of LA Supreme Court

name: Taliaferro, James

name: Underwood,
bio: Confederate deserter, colonel in state militia

name: Waples, Rufus

future.office: Candidate for secretary of state, inspector of state penitentiary
bio: Cousin of Gov. James Alcorn, former Whig, Unionist

name: Hemingway, William L. *
bio: Douglas Democrat, as state treasurer defaulted with $316,612

future.office: State representative, state treasurer, probate judge

name: Merryman, R. C.

bio: Union captain, placed in charge on NC's western dist. by Gov. Holden

bio: Unionist in secession crisis, perhaps Union veteran

bio: Sometimes classified as carpetbagger, Union veteran

bio: Son of former governor William A. Graham, wrote his autobiography, Confederate major

bio: A "red string" during war, replaced Alexander Williams as delegate

name: King, Richard
future.office: 1875 const. convention, state senator, customs house official

name: Logan, William
bio: Probably held additional personal property in 1860

name: McCubbins, John
bio: Replaced lsaac Shaver, who was never seated as a delegate

bio: Confederate officer, unseated and replaced by John Marshall

name: Pool, Charles
future.office: Superior court judge, mayor of Elizabeth City

name: Ray, Henry
bio: Involved in Gov. Holden's efforts to suppress KKK

name: Rodman, William
future.office: associate justice of NC Supreme Court

name: Trogden, Rueben
bio: Family produced a privately published family history

name: Williams, Alexander
bio: Unseated and replaced by Lorenzo Hall

name: Boozer, Lemuel
former.office: (1865 canst. convention, presidential elector in 1844, State senator)

name: Coghlan, Thomas
bio: Unionist, born aboard ship while parents were migrating from Ireland

name: Corley, Simeon
bio: Opposed secession in 1850s, temperance activist, forced into Confederate army at bayonet point

name: Crews, Joseph
bio: Assassinated in 1875, must have had personal property in 1860

name: Goss, James
bio: Confederate veteran, testified in KKK hearings

name: Mackey, Edmund
bio: Son of Albert Mackey, editor of Charleston Republican, married Victoria Sumter, an African American woman

name: Moses, Franklin
bio: Drug addict, allegedly raised Confederate flag at Ft. Sumter in April1861

name: Newell, N.J.
bio: Alt. delegate to 1868 Republican national convention

name: Olsen, Charles
bio: Confederate veteran Anti-secessionist, Confederate conscript, deserted and joined Union army

name: Richmond, A. C.
bio: Confederate veteran who was imprisoned in Charleston for disloyalty

name: Rose, William
bio: Confederate veteran, had trouble with KKK

name: Rutland, James

name: Woolley, John
bio: Sometimes classified as black, threatened by KKK

name: Armstrong, James
former.office: (TX Congress 1830s-40s, delegate to annexation convention of 1845)

name: Armstrong, Micajah*
former.office: (TN legislator, Unionist in TX legislature in 1860, delegate to 1866 TX canst. convention)

name: Bledsoe, Albert
future.office: state comptroller; delegate to 18721iberal Republican national convention

name: Buffington, Anderson*
bio: Opposed secession, in Battle of San Jacinto, two sons in Confederate army

name: Burnett, James*
future.office: State representative, district judge, state senator

name: Degener, Edwardt
bio: Imprisoned during war because of Unionist sympathy, two sons executed by Confederates for treason

former.office: (Delegate to annexation convention of 1845, American party congressman, 1855-57)
bio: Unionist, pro-Douglas in 1860, fled state in 1861

name: Fayle, William*

former.office: (State senator, state representative, delegate to 1866 canst. convention)
future.office: state senator, U.S. Senate, it. governor

future.office: State senator, delegate to 1875 canst. convention, Internal Revenue collector, delegate to Republican national conventions of 1872, 1880, 1884, 1888, 1892,1896
bio: Son of James Flanagan, opposed secession, Confederate general

name: Goddin, Mortimer
bio: Unionist, Freedmen's Bureau official, threatened, mayor of Huntsville

name: Grigsby, Aaron
bio: Always loyal, forced to resign his ministry at start of Civil War because of Unionist sympathies

former.office: (State attorney general, U.S. Congress, military governor, provisional governor)
bio: Anti-secessionist, pro-Douglas in 1860, Union general, probably had property

bio: Constitutional Unionist in secession crisis, brother of A. J.Hamilton

name: Johnson, Samuel
bio: Some problems with middle initial (M or W)

name: Keuchler, Jacobt
bio: Unionist, founded Tusculum Utopian, attacked by Confederates (Battle of Nueces) while attempting to flee state

name: Mundine, Tirus*

name: Pedigo, Henry
bio: Town of Pedigo named after family

name: Berkeley, Norborne*

name: Gibboney, James*
bio: Claimed to have been loyal during war

bio: Brother of Eustace Gibson, Confederate colonel

name: Harris, Adolphus*
bio: Confederate veteran, clerk in Gen. Wise's headquarters Confederate captain

name: McLaughlin,
bio: Confederate colonel, trustee of Washington and Lee College

name: Marye, John, Jr.*
bio: Former Whig, father was member of secession convention and voted for secession

name: Plaster, George*
bio: Secessionist, Confederate captain, had gone to CA during gold rush Union officer

bio: Secessionist, Confederate major on George Pickett's staff

bio: Former Whig, editor of Stanton Spectator

name: Wicker, Herbert
